name: Mechanical Load Static Test (2400Pa)
description: Static mechanical load test to determine the ability of a PV module to withstand wind, snow, ice, and static loads. The module is subjected to a uniform load of 2400 Pa applied perpendicular to the module surface for a specified duration. This test evaluates structural integrity, deflection characteristics, and electrical performance degradation under load.
safety_requirements: Wear safety glasses at all times
Ensure test area is clear of personnel during load application
Use proper lifting techniques when handling modules (minimum 2 persons for modules >20kg)
Verify pressure system integrity before test initiation
Install emergency stop button within reach
Ensure adequate lighting for visual inspection
Follow electrical safety protocols during IV measurements
Secure module to prevent sliding or shifting during test

tests.name: Pre-Test Visual Inspection
tests.description: Conduct thorough visual inspection of the module to document baseline condition before applying mechanical load
operator_instructions: Photograph module from all angles (front, back, edges)
Check for any existing cracks, chips, or defects in glass
Inspect frame for dents, corrosion, or damage
Verify junction box is securely attached
Document cell interconnections visible through glass
Note any discoloration or delamination
Record module serial number and specifications
Complete pre-test inspection checklist

tests.name: Baseline Electrical Characterization
tests.description: Measure initial electrical parameters to establish baseline performance before mechanical loading
operator_instructions: Allow module to stabilize at 25°C ±2°C
Clean module surface with approved cleaning method
Position module under solar simulator
Verify irradiance uniformity across module surface
Perform IV curve trace
Record Voc, Isc, Pmax, Vmp, Imp, FF
Compare results to manufacturer nameplate ratings
Save IV curve data to test database

tests.name: Module Mounting and Setup
tests.description: Mount module securely in test frame with proper support and measurement instrumentation
operator_instructions: Mount module in test frame with glass side facing up
Support all four edges with minimum 25mm overlap
Ensure module is level (±1 degree)
Position deflection sensors at center and quarter points
Install pressure sensors at multiple points
Position air bladder system over module glass surface
Ensure bladder covers entire module area uniformly
Connect sensors to data acquisition system
Verify all sensor readings are zero/baseline
Perform sensor calibration check

tests.name: Load Application to 2400Pa
tests.description: Apply uniform mechanical load of 2400 Pa (equivalent to ~240 kg/m²) to module surface
operator_instructions: Verify all personnel clear of test area
Initiate data acquisition recording
Begin gradual pressure application at 100 Pa/min
Monitor pressure uniformity across bladder
Observe module for any visible deformation
Listen for any cracking or breaking sounds
Verify pressure reaches 2400 Pa ±50 Pa
Monitor deflection readings continuously
Maintain pressure at 2400 Pa for 60 minutes
Check for any leaks in bladder system
Document any anomalies or observations
If deflection exceeds 40mm, initiate emergency stop

tests.name: Load Monitoring and Hold
tests.description: Maintain constant load while monitoring for creep, permanent deformation, or failure
operator_instructions: Monitor pressure stability continuously
Adjust bladder pressure as needed to maintain 2400 Pa
Track deflection creep rate
Observe for any progressive cracking or damage
Document time-stamped observations
Monitor environmental conditions
Verify data acquisition is recording properly

tests.name: Load Release and Recovery
tests.description: Gradually release mechanical load and measure elastic recovery of module
operator_instructions: Reduce pressure gradually at 200 Pa/min
Monitor deflection recovery
Allow 15 minutes for full elastic recovery
Measure residual deflection after recovery period
Calculate elastic recovery percentage
Document recovery behavior

tests.name: Post-Test Visual Inspection
tests.description: Comprehensive visual inspection to identify any damage caused by mechanical loading
operator_instructions: Remove module carefully from test frame
Photograph module from same angles as pre-test
Compare to pre-test photos for any changes
Inspect glass surface for cracks or chips
Check cells for microcracks or fractures
Look for signs of delamination
Inspect frame for bending or damage
Verify junction box integrity
Document any new defects or changes
Complete post-test inspection checklist

tests.name: Post-Test Electrical Characterization
tests.description: Measure electrical parameters after mechanical loading to assess performance degradation
operator_instructions: Allow module to stabilize at 25°C ±2°C
Clean module surface if needed
Position module under solar simulator
Perform IV curve trace using same conditions as pre-test
Record all electrical parameters
Calculate degradation percentages vs. pre-test values
Compare to IEC 61215 acceptance limits (≤5% Pmax degradation)
Document any anomalies in IV curve shape
Generate comparison plots (pre-test vs. post-test)

tests.name: Data Analysis and Reporting
tests.description: Analyze all collected data and generate comprehensive test report
operator_instructions: Review all measurement data for completeness
Generate pressure vs. time plot
Generate deflection vs. time plot
Create IV curve comparison plot
Calculate all performance metrics
Determine pass/fail status per IEC 61215
Complete test report template
Include all photos and documentation
Archive raw data files
Submit report for technical review
Update test database with results
